question.questionA: Carpels few, usually one to seven, each a follicle or rarely a berry
question.questionB: Carpels numerous, more than seven, each a one-seeded achene.

question.questionA: Flowers without spur or hood, actinomorphic.
question.questionB: Flowers with spur or hood, usually zygomorphic.

question.questionA: Leaves finely divided into narrow segments; petals present.
question.questionB: Leaves palmate or trifoliate; petals replaced by caducous tubular nectaries, sepals often petaloid.

question.questionA: Leaves divided into seven to nine segments.
question.questionB: Leaves trifoliate.

question.questionA: Flowers white.
question.questionB: Flowers purple.

question.questionA: Cauline leaves whorled or absent.
question.questionB: Cauline leaves alternate or opposite.

question.questionA: Leaves linear; flowers green.
question.questionB: Leaves lobed; flowers not green.

question.questionA: Woody climbers; leaves opposite; petals absent, sepals petaloid.
question.questionB: Herbaceous plants; leaves alternate; petals present.

question.questionA: Flowers solitary.
question.questionB: Flowers in panicles.

question.questionA: Leaves irregularly pinnate; sepals greenish white.
question.questionB: Leaves irregularly bipinnate; sepals creamy white.

question.questionA: Petals without a nectary; flowers red or yellow.
question.questionB: Petals with a flap-like nectary at the base; flowers yellow or white.

question.questionA: Flowers red; inner margin of achene straight.
question.questionB: Flowers yellow;  inner margin  of achene with a projection near the beak.

question.questionA: Aquatic plants; flowers white.
question.questionB: Terrestrial plants; flowers yellow.

question.questionA: Trilobed laminate leaves present; petals 10 mm or more.
question.questionB: Trilobed laminate leaves absent; petals rarely over 5 mm.

question.questionA: Annuals.
question.questionB: Perennials.

question.questionA: Sepals reflexed; stem not bulbous at the base.
question.questionB: Sepals not reflexed.

question.questionA: Plant  hairy;  all  leaves  broad  and  deeply  tri lobed; upper leaves overlapping to form a ?ruff” around the stem; receptacle not elongated in fruit.
question.questionB: Plant  glabrous;  upper  leaves  narrowly  spathulate  with prominent irregular teeth; receptacle elongated in fruit.

question.questionA: Upper leaves entire, tongue-shaped.
question.questionB: Upper leaves divided.

question.questionA: Upper leaves divided into linear segments; achenes with long curved spines on the border and shorter spines on ridges on the face.
question.questionB: Segments of upper leaves not linear; borders of achenes without spines.

question.questionA: Pedicels erect in fruit.
question.questionB: Pedicels recurved in fruit.

question.questionA: Lowest  leaves  simple,  other  three-lobed;  flowers  10-15  mm  in diameter; achenes 2 mm, with rounded tubercles and a short beak.
question.questionB: All leaves shallowly lobed; flowers less than 10 mm; achenes 7-8 mm, with a spiny face and long beak.

question.questionA: Plants hairy; pedicels only slightly thickened in fruit.
question.questionB: Plants glabrous; pedicels strongly thickened in fruit.

question.questionA: Sepals reflexed; stem bulbous at the base.
question.questionB: Sepals not reflexed; stem not bulbous at the base.

question.questionA: Basal leaves up to 12 cm or more across.
question.questionB: Basal leaves much less than 12 cm across.

question.questionA: Plants with stolons.
question.questionB: Plants not stoloniferous.

question.questionA: Plants with fleshy tubers; pedicels not furrowed; receptacle elongated in fruit.
question.questionB: Plants without tubers; pedicels furrowed; receptacle not elongated in fruit.

question.questionA: Leaves entire, cordate; petals more than five.
question.questionB: Leaves divided; petals five.

question.questionA: Plants with tubers; receptacle elongated in fruit
question.questionB: Plants without tubers; receptacle not elongated in fruit.
